page.title: 09CARLTON HOUSE
page.content: {Carlton House}is an{Old People's Home. There are rooms for{forty residents; there are{7 men and 33 women.}The oldest person is 96 and the youngest 69. In the Home there are 3 sitting rooms, 1 dining room, lots of bedrooms and bathrooms; most of the bedrooms are shared by 2 people. The house has a lift as well as stairs. Most of the residents like the Home and have lots of friends; quite a few of the old people use walking frames and some are deaf. They play Bingo every 2 months. The residents pay{part {of their State Pension}to live at the Home. Family and friends come to visit them; they get presents at Christmas but just cards on their birthdays. I think that old people's homes are a good idea but{I don't want to live in {one when I get old.
